# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a Julia function `wrap_string` that does what you described:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str) # Split the string into an array of words
    wrapped_words = String[] # Create an empty array to store the wrapped words

    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_words) > 0 && length(wrapped_words[end]) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            # If the current word would exceed the maximum text width, add a newline and start a new line
            push!(wrapped_words, "\n$(wrapped_words[end])")
        end
        push!(wrapped_words, word) # Add the current word to the array
    end

    return join(wrapped_words, "") # Join the array of wrapped words into a single string
end
```

Here's an example of how you can use this function:

```julia
str = "This is a very long sentence with many words that would exceed the maximum text width without wrapping."
wrapped_str = wrap_string(str)
println(wrapped_str) # Print the wrapped string
```
